DOC.brief_summary: Orthokeratology ( ortho-k ) clinical technique use reverse geometry rigid gas permeable contact lens exert positive pressure central cornea temporary reduce refractive error . The investigator show treatment effective myopic control low high myope , without astigmatism . Most designs ortho-k lens market fit base Jessen formula . The compression factor introduce compensate regression ortho-k effect lens-wear period , wearer obtain clear distance vision throughout day lens design use compression factor 0.50-0.75D . However , retrospective study ( mixed brand ortho-k lens ) , show patient achieve over-correction 0.75D . In order achieve over-correction 0.75D , extra flatten power 1.50D instead 0.75D target . The increased compression factor expect increase target reduction may play role myopic control provide high successful rate fit ortho-k lens .
DOC.brief_title: Investigation Effect Short-term Orthokeratology With Increased Compression Factor Ocular Parameters
DOC.criteria: 1 . 6 10 year old 2 . Myopia : 0.50 D 4.00 D eye 3 . Astigmatism : < 1.50 D ; ≤ 1.25 D withtherule astigmatism ( axes 180 ± 30 ) ; ≤ 0.50 D astigmatism ax eye 4 . Anisometropia : ≤ 1.50 D 5 . Symmetrical corneal topography corneal toricity < 2.00 D eye 6 . Agree randomization 1 . Contraindications orthokeratology wear ( e.g . limbustolimbus corneal cylinder dislocate corneal apex ) 2 . Any type strabismus amblyopia 3 . Myopic treatment ( e.g . refractive surgery progressive lens wear myopic control ) study period 4 . Rigid contact lens ( include orthokeratology lens ) experience 5 . Systemic condition might affect refractive development ( example , Down syndrome , Marfan 's syndrome ) 6 . Ocular condition might affect refractive error ( example , cataract , ptosis ) 7 . Poor compliance lens wear followup
